title: What can I do if I can't send or receive multimedia messages?
answer:
You may not be able to send a multimedia message when the network condition or signal reception is poor. You can try sending it again later.

The message is denied by the network (MMS center).

− You may not be able to send a multimedia message when the network is busy. You can try sending it again later.

− The recipient number is invalid and the message is denied by the network (MMS center). Check whether the recipient number is correct and try again.

− The multimedia message exceeds the maximum size (300 KB) allowed by your service provider. Delete some content from the multimedia message to make sure it does not exceed 300 KB, and try again.

Your account balance is insufficient.

You may not be able to send a multimedia message when your phone's storage is insufficient. Recharge your account and try again.

Your phone is running out of available storage space.

You may not be able to send a multimedia message when your phone's storage is insufficient. Free up your phone's storage space and make sure the available storage space is at least 300 KB.
